sentences.english: The workers were frequently beaten and were forced to live in prison-like conditions.
sentences.chinese: 工人們經常捱打捱餓，被迫在監牢般的環境中生活。

sentences.english: He was still good when he arrived at the galleys.
sentences.chinese: 初進監牢時他還是個好人。

sentences.english: The will to power strikes against the wall of being, which has become a prison.
sentences.chinese: 權力意志衝擊着已經成了一座監牢的存在之牆。

sentences.english: He opens the plastic tubes and unrolls blueprints of the cell block.
sentences.chinese: 他打開塑料管，鋪開監獄監牢區的設計圖。

sentences.english: So why is Rasheed still lingering in jail, five years later?
sentences.chinese: 但5年之後，拉希德仍舊在監牢中枯坐終年。

sentences.english: Debt is an imprisonment to our happiness.
He was thrown into prison and left to rot.
sentences.chinese: 他被關進監牢任其苟延殘喘。

sentences.english: They were clapped into prison without trial.
sentences.chinese: 他們未經審訊就立即被關進監牢裏。

sentences.english: I have passed nineteen years in the galleys.
To cover the other martyrs, Ding W perish caught, put in prison.
sentences.chinese: 爲掩護其他殉教者，瓦淪丁被抓住，投入了監牢。

sentences.english: Paul leans back against the wall of his cell and smiles.
sentences.chinese: 然後保羅背靠着他監牢的牆壁，微笑着。

sentences.english: When he was jolted awake, the prison doors were open.
sentences.chinese: 當他被監牢的震動驚醒時，看見監門打開了。

sentences.english: Soc. I wonder the keeper of the prison would let you in.
sentences.chinese: 我在想監牢的守衛怎會讓你進來？

sentences.english: The cover of other martyrs, Valentine was caught, put in jail.
sentences.chinese: 爲掩護其他殉教者，瓦淪丁被抓住，投入了監牢。

sentences.english: He had only succeeded in escaping into a prison.
sentences.chinese: 只有在監牢中越獄纔會成功。

definition: to condemn in speech and in writing (idiom)/to denounce by word and pen
to frame sb (by planting sth on them)
head and face filthy with grime (idiom)/covered in dirt/dejected and depressed
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
all black, no daylight (idiom); a world without justice
to decide and act alone (idiom); to take arbitrary action/a law unto oneself
to denounce/to condemn/to call to account/to punish
